item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, May 19, 2025 at 8:25 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: Goboscript, text-based programming language, compiles to Scratch (68 points | 17 comments)
2. InventWood is about to mass-produce wood that's stronger than steel (54 points | 34 comments)
3. Show HN: Sshsync – CLI tool to run shell commands across multiple remote servers (16 points | 5 comments)
4. New research reveals the strongest solar event ever detected, in 12350 BC (167 points | 79 comments)
5. `This Printer company served you malware for months, called them false positives (36 points | 8 comments)
6. Spaced repetition systems have gotten better (852 points | 452 comments)
7. “There are people who can see and others who cannot even look” (122 points | 21 comments)
8. Ditching Obsidian and building my own (329 points | 353 comments)
9. Layers All the Way Down: The Untold Story of Shader Compilation (51 points | 19 comments)
10. Show HN: I modeled the Voynich Manuscript with SBERT to test for structure (331 points | 101 comments)
11. Font Activations: A Note on the Type (29 points | discuss)
12. France Endorses UN Open Source Principles (427 points | 106 comments)
13. Llama from scratch (2023) (23 points | discuss)
14. Show HN: Job board aggregator for best paying remote SWE jobs in the U.S. (49 points | 38 comments)
15. $30 Homebrew Automated Blinds Opener (252 points | 113 comments)
16. The Connoisseur of Desire (19 points | discuss)
17. Spaced Repetition Memory System (217 points | 25 comments)
18. The principles of database design, or, the Truth is out there (56 points | 49 comments)
19. Show HN: I reinvented PHP in TypeScript (demo) (3 points | 1 comment)
20. K-Scale Labs: Open-source humanoid robots, built for developers (94 points | 42 comments)
21. Hyper Typing (81 points | 55 comments)
22. What do wealthy people buy, that ordinary people know nothing about? (2015) (152 points | 234 comments)
23. Show HN: Vaev – A browser engine built from scratch (It renders google.com) (183 points | 104 comments)
24. Show HN: A platform to find tech conferences, discounts, and ticket giveaways (71 points | 21 comments)
25. Comparing Parallel Functional Array Languages: Programming and Performance (74 points | 12 comments)
26. Show HN: Python Simulator of David Deutsch’s “Constructor Theory of Time” (68 points | 7 comments)
27. The Fall of Roam (2022) (113 points | 62 comments)
28. The Tongue Is a Fire (19 points | 7 comments)
29. Mystical (393 points | 44 comments)
30. In Memoriam: John L. Young, Cryptome Co-Founder (199 points | 24 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, May 19, 2025 at 8:25 AM UTC
